engChrName: At the time, the anti-immigrant sentiment wasn't quite as strong.
engSearchText:
At the time, the anti-immigrant sentiment wasn't
quite as strong.
jpnChrName: 当時は反移民主義的な風潮も そこまで強くは無かったみたいで……
jpnSearchText:
当時は反移民主義的な風潮も
そこまで強くは無かったみたいで……

engChrName: Professor Hamilton's proposal was quickly accepted by the Institute of Science and the Artisanal District.
engSearchText:
Professor Hamilton's proposal was quickly accepted
by the Institute of Science and the Artisanal District.
jpnChrName: ハミルトン博士の提案は、理科大学と 職人街にすぐに受け入れられたそうです。
jpnSearchText:
ハミルトン博士の提案は、理科大学と
職人街にすぐに受け入れられたそうです。

engChrName: And so forty-five years ago, the Institute of Science and the Artisans' Guild came together to establish the Verne Company.
engSearchText:
And so forty-five years ago, the Institute of Science
and the Artisans' Guild came together to establish the
Verne Company.
jpnChrName: そして理科大学と職人組合の産学共同で ４５年前に《ヴェルヌ社》が創業──
jpnSearchText:
そして理科大学と職人組合の産学共同で
４５年前に《ヴェルヌ社》が創業──

engChrName: They then went on to further orbal technology in new, innovative ways.
engSearchText:
They then went on to further orbal technology in
new, innovative ways.
jpnChrName: 他国とは違うアプローチで 導力技術を発展させてきたわけだな。
jpnSearchText:
他国とは違うアプローチで
導力技術を発展させてきたわけだな。

engChrName: Right. Like how Calvard and the Verne Company were the first to develop orbal cars.
engSearchText:
Right. Like how Calvard and the Verne Company
were the first to develop orbal cars.
jpnChrName: そういえば“導力車”を作ったのも 共和国のヴェルヌが最初なんだよね。
jpnSearchText:
そういえば“導力車”を作ったのも
共和国のヴェルヌが最初なんだよね。

engChrName: That eventually led to the four big car manufacturers being established as affiliated companies.
engSearchText:
That eventually led to the four big car manufacturers
being established as affiliated companies.
jpnChrName: その後、関連企業として導力車の 四大ライセンシーも立ち上がったし。
jpnSearchText:
その後、関連企業として導力車の
四大ライセンシーも立ち上がったし。

engChrName: And while Calvard pioneered orbal cars, the Empire was the first one to develop orbal trains, and Liberl the first to develop orbal airships.
engSearchText:
And while Calvard pioneered orbal cars, the Empire
was the first one to develop orbal trains, and Liberl
the first to develop orbal airships.
jpnChrName: ふふ……ちなみに導力鉄道は帝国、 飛行船はリベールが最初になるわね。
jpnSearchText:
ふふ……ちなみに導力鉄道は帝国、
飛行船はリベールが最初になるわね。

engChrName: It's amazing, the kinds of things a little research uncovers about the history of something so commonplace.
engSearchText:
It's amazing, the kinds of things a little research
uncovers about the history of something
so commonplace.
jpnChrName: 歴史や背景も含めて紐解いていくと 中々考察しがいのあるテーマかしら。
jpnSearchText:
歴史や背景も含めて紐解いていくと
中々考察しがいのあるテーマかしら。

engChrName: All good to know, too. I'll have to keep it all in mind for my report.
engSearchText:
All good to know, too. I'll have to keep it all in mind
for my report.
jpnChrName: なるほど、レポートの参考にします。
jpnSearchText: なるほど、レポートの参考にします。

engChrName: And we're not even done, because all that links to the development of films!
engSearchText:
And we're not even done, because all that links to the
development of films!
jpnChrName: そこから導力技術は映画の発展にも 繋がっていくんだねぇ……！
jpnSearchText:
そこから導力技術は映画の発展にも
繋がっていくんだねぇ……！

engChrName: Hmm... Isn't this all a bit too simple for a topic?
engSearchText: Hmm... Isn't this all a bit too simple for a topic?
jpnChrName: フン……テーマとしては ありきたりすぎじゃないのか？
jpnSearchText:
フン……テーマとしては
ありきたりすぎじゃないのか？

engChrName: Aww. Don't be like that.
engSearchText: Aww. Don't be like that.
jpnChrName: もう、水を差さないの。
jpnSearchText: もう、水を差さないの。

engChrName: (Heehee. Oh, to be a student again. When I was their age...)
engSearchText:
(Heehee. Oh, to be a student again. When I was
their age...)
jpnChrName: （フフ、学生って感じね。   私もあれくらいの頃は……）
jpnSearchText:
（フフ、学生って感じね。
私もあれくらいの頃は……）

engChrName: (Wait! I'm only twenty-one! I'm not an old pile of bones yet!)
engSearchText:
(Wait! I'm only twenty-one! I'm not an old pile of
bones yet!)
jpnChrName: （──って私もまだ２１！   まだまだ負けてられないわ……！）
jpnSearchText:
（──って私もまだ２１！
まだまだ負けてられないわ……！）

engChrName: ...Our hot-ass president, Roy Gramheart!
engSearchText: ...Our hot-ass president, Roy Gramheart!
jpnChrName: ──ロイ・グラムハート大統領！ 我らがイケオジプレジデントってわけだな！
jpnSearchText:
──ロイ・グラムハート大統領！
我らがイケオジプレジデントってわけだな！

engChrName: Heehee! It's funny hearing you say it out loud, but yeah, he IS pretty hot for his age, huh?
engSearchText:
Heehee! It's funny hearing you say it out loud, but
yeah, he IS pretty hot for his age, huh?
jpnChrName: ふふっ、なにその呼び方。 でもスクリーン映えしそうだよね～。
jpnSearchText:
ふふっ、なにその呼び方。
でもスクリーン映えしそうだよね～。

engChrName: He's become a big name even in the Empire. For a... variety of reasons.
engSearchText:
He's become a big name even in the Empire. For a...
variety of reasons.
jpnChrName: 帝国でも名が知れ渡っていますね。 ……色んな意味で、ですけど。
jpnSearchText:
帝国でも名が知れ渡っていますね。
……色んな意味で、ですけど。

engChrName: ...I'm sure.
engSearchText: ...I'm sure.
jpnChrName: ……そうでしょうね。
jpnSearchText: ……そうでしょうね。

engChrName: Well, that just goes to show how big a deal he is on an international scale.
engSearchText:
Well, that just goes to show how big a deal he is on
an international scale.
jpnChrName: ま、まあそれだけ国際的にも 重要な役割を果たしてるって事で。
jpnSearchText:
ま、まあそれだけ国際的にも
重要な役割を果たしてるって事で。

engChrName: Yeah. For how difficult things were at the end of the war, he's done a pretty stellar job of steering our ship.
engSearchText:
Yeah. For how difficult things were at the end of the
war, he's done a pretty stellar job of steering our ship.
jpnChrName: 戦後の難しい情勢下で立派に 舵取りをしているんじゃないか？
jpnSearchText:
戦後の難しい情勢下で立派に
舵取りをしているんじゃないか？

engChrName: (Heehee...)
engSearchText: (Heehee...)

engChrName: (It is true that the current government is handling things extremely well.)
engSearchText:
(It is true that the current government is handling
things extremely well.)
jpnChrName: （……確かに現政権は   この上なく上手くやっている。）
jpnSearchText:
（……確かに現政権は
この上なく上手くやっている。）

engChrName: (But that's more because...)
engSearchText: (But that's more because...)
jpnChrName: （でもそれは──……）
jpnSearchText: （でもそれは──……）
